security: Disclosing the agent's intention to help DMCHAR devise a communication strategy could expose methods, such as asking DMCHAR's wife to contact FEDEZ de Castro. This could compromise ongoing intelligence-gathering efforts and put individuals at risk.
summary: This secret dispatch from August 1957 details a contact report with DMCHAR, covering topics from funding and communication strategies to information on Soviet presence and potential contacts within Castro's regime.
summary_one_paragraph: In August 1957, a secret dispatch was sent from KU (KARINZY) detailing a contact report with DMCHAR regarding their group's activities. DMCHAR reported slow progress due to lack of funds and communication with contacts in Cuba, while also mentioning a potential aircraft sale and past connections with Julio LOBO for fundraising. The dispatch further discusses plans for a propaganda program, DMCHAR's knowledge of Soviet presence in Cuba through Douglas ROOT, and potential contacts within Raul CASTRO's circle, including an introduction to Fidel Castro's secretary. The dispatch concludes with a recommendation to pass DMCHAR's suggestion of contacting FEDEZ de Castro to the Havana Station.
title: Report of Contact with DMCHAR on 13 August 1957
